intro: Fleischmannia saxorum, commonly known as the saxicolous fleischmannia, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. This plant is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, often growing on cliffs and among boulders in dry environments. Fleischmannia saxorum produces showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
